title: SF311 Prior Case Data Structure
description:
Demonstration data set for data prior to the changes made on 20 April 2017:
https://data.sfgov.org/City-Infrastructure/Case-Data-from-San-Francisco-311-SF311-/vw6y-z8j6

columns.name: CASEID
columns.description: The unique ID of the service request created.

columns.name: OPENED
columns.description: The date and time when the service request was made

columns.name: CLOSED
columns.description: The date and time when the service request was closed

columns.name: UPDATED
columns.description: The date and time when the service request was last modified. For requests with status=closed, this will be the date the request was closed

columns.name: STATUS
columns.description: A single-word indicator of the current state of the service request.

columns.name: STATUS NOTES
columns.description: Explanation of why status was changed to current state or more details on current status than conveyed with status alone

columns.name: RESPONSIBLE AGENCY
columns.description: The agency responsible for fulfilling or otherwise addressing the service request.

columns.name: CATEGORY
columns.description: The human readable name of the service request type

columns.name: REQUEST TYPE
columns.description: The human readable name of the service request subtype

columns.name: REQUEST DETAILS
columns.description: The human readable name of the service request details

columns.name: ADDRESS
columns.description: Human readable address or description of location

columns.name: SUPERVISOR DISTRICT
columns.description: San Francisco Supervisor District as defined in 'Supervisor Districts as of April 2012' 0 When No Address Associated.

columns.name: NEIGHBORHOOD
columns.description: San Francisco Neighborhood as defined in 'SF Find Neighborhoods'

columns.name: POINT
columns.description: Combination of Latitude and Longitude for Socrata native maps

columns.name: SOURCE
columns.description: Mechanism or path by which the service request was received; typically ‘Phone’, ‘Text/SMS’, ‘Website’, ‘Mobile App’, ‘Twitter’, etc but terms may vary by system.

columns.name: MEDIA URL
columns.description: A URL to media associated with the request, e.g. an image. Certain images redacted to protect the privacy of individuals.
